newsitem.title: USA: TENNIS-FOURTH SEED O'BRIEN ADVANCES IN ORLANDO.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-FOURTH SEED O'BRIEN ADVANCES IN ORLANDO.

text.p: Fourth seed Alex O'Brien overcame a shaky start and an off day at the service line to post a three-set, second-round victory over Denmark's Kenneth Carlsen at the U.S. Men's Clay Court Championships on Wednesday.
Heavy rain and tornadoes in the area postponed the start of play until the evening. When the weather finally cleared, O'Brien posted a 2-6 6-3 6-2 win over Carlsen to advance.
Sixth-seeded American Chris Woodruff and defending champion Fernando Meligeni of Brazil also moved on.
In a minor upset, South African Grant Stafford ousted eighth seed Sandon Stolle of Australia 6-2 6-3. Stolle is ranked just seven places ahead of the unseeded Stafford at 68th in the world.
Woodruff defeated Germany's Oliver Gross 7-5 7-6 (7-3), while Meligeni beat Martin Rodriguez of Argentina 6-4 6-2.
O'Brien was the highest seed to see action in a weak field with most of the world's top players at the Monte Carlo Open.
The 39th-ranked American got off to a slow start against 84th-ranked Carlsen, dropping his opening service game and falling behind 5-2 when Carlsen broke him again.
Carlsen, a steady groundstroker, served out the first set but fell behind quickly in the second.

O'Brien raced to 5-1 lead before his serve let him down again while serving for the set. With a comfortable lead, however, the American shrugged off the setback and broke Carlsen for the set in the next game with a backhand volley winner to level the match.
O'Brien got the early break in the third set for a 2-1 edge and worked Carlsen's weaker backhand side to build a commanding 5-2 lead.
This time, O'Brien served out the match, converting his third match point on a backhand error by the Dane.
"I was really happy I stayed in there," said O'Brien, reflecting on his early troubles. "I hung in there well and worked my way out of it.
"It's nice to know if I don't serve well I can back it up with a strong baseline game."
